thread.title: Stocks Waver In Mixed Trade; Ferrari, GM Steal The Show - Investors.com
thread.title_full: Stocks Waver In Mixed Trade; Ferrari, GM Steal The Show - Investors.com

author: yahoo
title: Stocks Waver In Mixed Trade; Ferrari, GM Steal The Show - Investors.com
text:
S tocks continued to struggle in mixed terrain at midday Wednesday as the auto industry took center stage. Ferrari came public with a roar, and General Motors and auto dealer Lithia Motors beat estimates. 
The Nasdaq swayed back and forth between narrow gains and losses; the S&P 500 inched up 0.1% and the Dow Jones industrial average was up 0.4% in the stock market today . Volume tracked higher than the same time Tuesday on both the NYSE and the Nasdaq exchanges. 
Italian automaker Ferrari (NYSE: RACE ) came public with an on-key exhaust note, rising quickly from a 52 offering price. It rose as high as 60.97 before settling near 56 by midday. 
Other car stocks were strong. General Motors (NYSE: GM ) reported earnings that handily beat estimates and said China sales were up 10%. It gapped up and was trading 5% higher. 
Lithia Motors (NYSE: LAD ) blew away estimates and was 3% higher. It has found support for the third time in three months at its 200-day moving average. 
Among IBD 50 stocks, the best performer was software maker SolarWinds (NYSE: SWI ), up 16% in monster volume. It has agreed to be acquired by private equity firms Silver Lake and Thoma Bravo for $4.6 billion. 
Manhattan Associates (NASDAQ: MANH ), another IBD 50 name, rose 5%. After the close Tuesday, it reported results that beat The Street and guided fiscal year 2015 higher. The stock hit a new high, extended from a lop-sided cup-with-handle base with a 65.63 buy point. 
Chipotle Mexican Grill (NYSE: CMG ) reported disappointing earnings after the close Tuesday. It gapped down and was trading 7% lower.
